website_summaries.verdict: The HP ScanJet Pro 2500 f1 Flatbed Scanner has a good software suite, and can scan either from its flatbed or 50-sheet ADF.
cons: Slow in scanning to searchable PDF format, especially at default settings

customer_reviews.title: Excellent color scanner for legal size and longer document.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice flatbed and sheet-fed color scanner suitable for clear crisp legal size documents. The sheet feeder works very smoothly and reliably. I got it to save trips to FedEx copy center. Interface to computer is through a USB2 cable (not Ethernet or Wifi). This scanner is exactly what I needed to scan legal documents in a small office environment.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Does not scan to pdf
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to scan receipts to pdf however it only scans to images. That did not work for me, however my biggest disappointment was with trying to return it. Because I chose to pay for UPS to pick it up, I was sent an email with instructions that UPS would send someone out with a label and pick it up. Every UPS person who came never had a label and now I have missed my window to return the item and am stuck with it.
customer_reviews.author: tfrose1

customer_reviews.title: Does not integrate with my Apple computer for text.  OK for photos.
customer_reviews.text: This machine came with two disks which ONLY work for Windows computers, not Macs. Also, the directions were minimal. When I spoke with a representative because an Apple driver for my computer was not available to download on line, he admitted that none was available and might not be for two years. I can scan photos but can not scan text. At this point, I am considering returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary C. Woodel

customer_reviews.title: Great for written homework during the COVID pandemic
customer_reviews.text: This scanner has been a great for getting through the COVID reality: working and school from home. We have been able to scan and submit our child's written homework, do remote deposits of checks, and scan and email documents that need a written signature. The HP scanner software that comes with it is OK. You don't have to use it, though. The scanner is TWAIN compliant, and there are several free, open-source scanner applications that will work with it. ETA: The sheet feeder is a bit fickle. The pages to be scanned must be pushed all the forward against the stop.
customer_reviews.author: Aldus Brokovich

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit with software issues.
customer_reviews.text: Nice scanner. Great for home or small business. With HP software -issues with Mac. Can use the feeder but not flatbed only. Can use Mac a oS generic program to run the flatbed but is not convenient. HP does not want to address their software issue so consider that.
customer_reviews.author: BuysLotsOfStuff

customer_reviews.title: Better on a Windows PC
customer_reviews.text: Not very Apple friendly. None of the function controls and status indicators on the front panel serve any purpose when used on a Mac. Better on a Windows PC. Poor support for Apple. HP Easy Scan is about the only software they have for a Mac. When you figure out how to make it do what you want it to do, scanning is quick and the quality is very good. Their website's downloads do not support the latest MacOS.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner, poor shipping/delivery
customer_reviews.text: I've only just received this scanner today, but this is a great scanner so far. Has all the features I needed, though it is pricey compared to something like an all-in-one printer/scanner/copier. My only complaint so far is that the packaging was damaged quite severely and patched with packing tape. The contents of the box seemed to be fine, but the corner that was damaged houses the power supply. I'll be keeping my eye on the power supply to make sure it doesn't catch fire.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: HP ScanJet Pro 2500 f1 Flatbed OCR Scanner = OUTSTANDING!
customer_reviews.text: I have used my new HP ScanJet Pro 2500 f1 Flatbed scan twice since purchasing, and it works as smooth as butter! It is fast, produces very clear scans, and feeds documents quickly without hesitation consistently without jams. Additionally, the scanning software is easy to use, and seems to function much like the HP Laserjet 100 MFP all-in-one scanning software, which for me was a relief. The scanner is an efficient and effective piece of equipment. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: P. Sink

customer_reviews.title: Won't Work with Catalina
customer_reviews.text: I scoped this issue out thoroughly before I bought this. Oddly, some folks could get this scanner to work with Catalina. Not me. HP was helpful, and I could get it to work with VueScan. But this was more scanner than I needed anyway and all the bells and whistles won't work if I'm operating it through VueScan. I received this today, and it's already packaged up and at UPS. I'm going to buy the old scanner I had and use it with VueScan. That worked fine and for less than a third of the price.
customer_reviews.author: suepow

customer_reviews.title: Automatice feeder is not fixable.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this scanner in my office for the last 3+years, the scanner does the job as it is supposed to. But the reason for 3 star rating that I am giving is the automatic feeder was broken right after the warranty was expired(I guess that was approximately 2 years ago). It got worse after that, HP doesn't have any solution for it. I am still using the scanner with only flatbed. I could probably understand the part can go wrong, but the manufacturer not having the solution was not professional.
customer_reviews.author: Kyung Duk Choi

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought another one for my office!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great product and use it almost daily. Bought my first for at home and ended up buying a second for my small office. The document works better than expected. It is most useful with the pay Adobe Acrobat -- can scan and edit forms with ease. I have recommended this product to friends and will again. I love HP products!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffry Olson

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up
customer_reviews.text: It's a basic scanner with a sheet feeder included. Very intuitive to use, and I suspect it will stay that way. It does not have a USB port to scan to, but instead relies on a cable to USB connection on your computer. Not a big deal but I've come to expect them.
customer_reviews.author: Mterpin

customer_reviews.title: What's good about the software is the ability to alter the ...
customer_reviews.text: This scanner comes with very intuitive software packed with features. What's good about the software is the ability to alter the scans after scanning is complete by changing colors, brightness, contrast, page order, and adding or removing pages. All of the scans come out clear, with high resolutions not taking too much time. By far, this scanner exceeds all of the competition with its single pass duplex scanning. This feature alone has made scanning much faster than the previous method of using a flatbed scanner to scan every page alone and having to handle every page scanned. Overall, this product performs very well.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: Really really really bad scanner
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all for Apple computers. So I move on to try the scanner out on a new PC. Software is 500 MB in size--ridiculous. Scanner gives one of three errors about a nonexistent jam or other issue for nearly every scan. Essentially the thing doesn't work at all, and wastes a lot of our time. Do not buy this horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Science Dad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance. No problems with the sheet feeder
customer_reviews.text: Excellent performance. No problems with the sheet feeder. 25 pages per minute - one-pass double-sided scan, and good photo scans too. Excellent OCR software. The drivers loaded easily, and the interface software is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Herschel Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Easy and efficient flawless performance
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is really excellent. It worked flawlessly right out of the box. I can scan two sided documents at the same time. The only downside to it is that the OCR is poor to the point of being unacceptable. Otherwise, it is the best scanner I have owned so far. Also. It is not limited to 8.5 x 11 inch paper.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad L. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Flatbed and duplex scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I liked the previous generation scanner. Overall, this one is much quieter and smoother. I especially like that the two-sided scanning is done in one pass rather than the old one manipulating the page for the second pass.
customer_reviews.author: VBS

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse scanner.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for the money. Have used it over and over again for scanning papers and magazine articles that I wanted to hold on to but without the clutter in my house. Is a genuine workhorse. Would definitely purchase again!!
customer_reviews.author: masckerade

customer_reviews.title: Jams after 3 weeks of usage
customer_reviews.text: The scanner tray worked great for about 3 weeks and then suddenly started jamming every single time I try to scan. It also puts a line through the scanned image. Looks like my return window has ended so I am stuck with this machine that slows me down instead of helping.
customer_reviews.author: Coolio

customer_reviews.title: Much more solid than most all-in-one printer/scanner units.
customer_reviews.text: This dedicated scanner does what it does day in and day out with high quality and low fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hefner

customer_reviews.title: Scan Away!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It is 95% dependable. Scans pretty well, has a feeder and HP software is easy to use. My only issue is that the feeder rollers sometime do not grab sheets and I have to clear the jambs/misfeeds. If there is a trick to getting them to work it would be 100% satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Darius Sarraf

customer_reviews.title: Great scan quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Great product but after a few days of scanning papers it's making a bit of a hard wurring sound when drawing paper in. Still working like a charm tho, I'll look into cleaning/maintaining it.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Hartman

customer_reviews.title: The scanner does great on the flat bed
customer_reviews.text: The scanner does great on the flat bed. The document fee only gets the documents about ever 8-10 tries. Have other HP document scanners no problems but also more money. This one needs adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: DNettles

customer_reviews.title: Terrible resolution. My 2 previous HP scanners would not ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible resolution. My 2 previous HP scanners would not interface with Windows 7 or 10 so I was forced to purchase a new one and needed an ADF. Scanning a B&W document in B&W mode results in poor text legibility. This happens in all modes B&W, Custom, ADF, Flat glass, 300, 600+. There is no adjustment for density (lighten or darken). Some improvement by scanning in Color but the improvement doesn't justify the increase in file size. I have always been a big supporter of HP peripherals, but ....... Not Any More. Epic Failure HP !! Very very D-I-S-A-P-P-O-I-N-T-E-D.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed in this scanner. It easily jams, it takes forever to feed paper through it. You’d think that have a slow feeder would prevent any paper jams but no, it doesn’t. It often scans two papers at once. The scanning quality is decent but I don’t like the software on the computer. You can’t change multiple documents at once which is frustrating. Not worth the purchase. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle Carper

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed that it doesn't seem to handle gloss photos at ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner specifically to scan in photographs. I am disappointed that it doesn't seem to handle gloss photos at all well, especially when there is a lot of light colors. I've added a photo so you can see the speckling. It's mostly in the upper right in this image. I've had no problem with the ADF once I figured out which way to orient the pictures in the feed tray. It feeds smoothly unless you overload the inlet tray. I haven't tried to do double sided copying yet so can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: James O. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Fancy and robust
customer_reviews.text: Had to return this because of the cost, but the features on this scanner are incredible! It also comes with a set of software that will make home business users' lives much easier, such as a business card organizer and advanced document search features.
customer_reviews.author: S.I.

customer_reviews.title: HP needs to discontinue or rework this product
customer_reviews.text: In two days of use, it repeatedly jams or just won't pull paper in. 9/10 times, it will not feed a single page. We am extremely disappointed in this product. It really is crap.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner has made my life of scanning forms in much better.
customer_reviews.author: Tubkat 63

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and setup! Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Problems setting up trhe scanner. Not great scanned results
customer_reviews.text: Not great scanned results. I don't know what I was missing. Could not install PaperPort correctly due to an old previous version.
customer_reviews.author: hqnguyen52

customer_reviews.title: ADF is the problem...
customer_reviews.text: ADF will not work. I replaced my first purchase and the second unit has the same problem. Doesn't grab the sheets consistently....probably about 1 out of every 10 tries. Software is great. The scans are super quick (when it grabs) and very good quality. If only the ADF worked...this would be a 4 or 5 star device.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Sheet Feeder
customer_reviews.text: The sheet feeder on the 2500 frequently grabs more than one page and jams. Despite the significantly higher price, go for the 3500, which has a reliable sheet feeder.
customer_reviews.author: S.P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement for our old HP 8250 Scanner at a ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice replacement for our old HP 8250 Scanner at a value price. Love how it scans both sides of a document at once. No complaints so far
customer_reviews.author: M. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: quick and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. Large footprint but the flat bed allows for awkward shapes and thicknesses or multiple overlays to be scanned at once.
customer_reviews.author: beverly

customer_reviews.title: MADE SCANNING EASIER
customer_reviews.text: It is a time saver, Made scanning easier, particularly if you have a lot of pages to scan.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, great purchase experience
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent scanner, it came quickly, in excellent condition, and words as advertised and just as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kelley

customer_reviews.title: It works fine with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: This scanner does not work with Linux. If I had known that, I would not have bought it. It works fine with Windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: jlboockh

customer_reviews.title: Works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Works incredibly fast,no lag time,no paper snags.well worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Thedrakes

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, BUT zero support!
customer_reviews.text: Works ok, but seems to be a glitch with driver download for Macs. When you call, no one answers!
customer_reviews.author: Roger Turner

customer_reviews.title: Scanner Needed for Home Office - Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: The speed, ease of use and quality of this product are impressive. I should have bought a scanner of this type years ago. It has saved me a lot of time, hassle and frustration. This is a great home-office scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Blade

customer_reviews.title: This one is a pass
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is fast and looks pretty, but that's about all thats good about it. First, although they say its duplex (two sided) scanning, thats not the case if you own a Mac. Also, the paper feeder jams ALL THE TIME. Upon reading further, it seems like all of HP's scanners have issues with jamming. I returned it and went with a Xerox. Not impressed at all HP. Get it together. Its a shame too, because I like your printers.
customer_reviews.author: David michail

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It keeps jamming up whenever I try to scan 15+ pages at once, or it'll push through multiple pages at once.
customer_reviews.author: Mikyoung Kim

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS SCANNER!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not Buy this scanner!!! I did not listen to the bad reviews. I should have. I purchase this scanner March 7, 2017 and it worked fine until today. It began to jam. I reset it several times and even tried different quality and different weights of paper. It keeps jamming. I have alredy purchased a better scanner that got very high reviews, even from a law office. If you are considering this printer DO NOT BUY IT, YOU WILL REGRET YOUR DECISION IF YOU DO.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Jams all the time
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is terrible. The ADF jams ALL the time for no reason. This scanner also takes FOREVER to save a file to the computer once the scan is complete. To be fair though, the upload speed to dropbox is pretty fast. I bought this to assist in scanning files for my office to go paperless, needless to say that process is not progressing.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Scanner broke in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The scanner broke in less than 3 months. The document feeder is no longer functional.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: From the beginning, document feeder function rarely worked. ...
customer_reviews.text: From the beginning, document feeder function rarely worked. Paper jammed continuously and not working. Paid $220.00 last August, 2017
customer_reviews.author: Sarihwaa

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It jams a lot and the quality not good. So hard to use. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Niloo

product_meta.title: HP Scanjet Pro 2500 f1
product_meta.description: Enhance productivity for routine scanning with a compact HP ScanJet Pro. Automate workflow with fast, two-sided scanning, a 50-page ADF, 1,500-page daily duty cycle, and one-button shortcuts. You can even quickly capture and edit text from documents.
feature_bullets: Boost productivity with fast, versatile scanning. Produce up to 40 images per minute with two-sided scanning and a 50-page automatic document feeder.
Scan pages up to 8.5 x 122 inches (21.6 cm x 309.9 cm) through the ADF, and use the flatbed for bulky media.
Don't wait for warm-up-Instant-on Technology lets you begin scanning quickly.
Sharp images and powerful editing tools. Accurately capture text from documents for easy editing with HP Scan and I.R.I.S. ReadirisTM Pro OCR software.
Get sharp, true-to-life scans of documents, graphics, and photos with up to 1200 dpi resolution. Easily edit and organize documents and photos with a full suite of feature-rich software.

specifications.Customer reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
